comment._content: The artist is François Flameng (1856-1923), Dorothy Payne Whitney (1887-1968) was the wife of Willard Dickerman Straight (1880-1918). Sources: François Flameng (1856-1923) Willard Dickerman Straight (1880-1918) Dorothy Payne Whitney (1887-1968)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From Wikipedia article for Willard Straight : "Straight married Dorothy Payne Whitney, a member of the prominent Whitney family, in 1911 after 5 years of courtship. They married in Geneva, Switzerland, and moved to China. They moved back to the United States in 1912, having judged it too unsafe due to the Chinese Revolution. In 1915, Straight, his wife and Herbert Croly began the publication of The New Republic, a weekly political magazine." Straight died in 1918. In 1922 she gave his estate to Cornell to construct a building at Cornell University named after Willard Straight. See cornellsun.com/node/26950 She didn't become Mrs L. K. Elmhirst until April 1925 -- which means that the lower caption can't have been added until then.
